pros: Executive team tries to keep pace with salaries in a non profit world.
cons: Long time staff with negative attitudes eat the young
pay is not the best could be better

review_title: After a pandemic you’d think the lab would be cherished more
pros: Some of my coworkers became life long friends.
cons:
We became lifelong friends because we commiserated over how badly we were paid and treated. 

Over the three year span I worked for this place, I cannot recount how many times we were told to hold on because the other company buying us would “pay us so much more” or it will get better. Don’t take anything someone tells you at face value about your position because it could change on a dime. Until you see the change don’t trust it. I ended up becoming more cynical than I ever have been due to the way management covers for bad behavior if the person is someone they happen to like at the time. Anyone who wants to make any form of change if it’s neutral or good is strongly discouraged to do so not just by upper management, but coworkers as well. This company is stuck in the prehistoric era.

pros: I like my coworkers on second shift
cons: No opportunity for promotions. No raises. Underpaid compared to surrounding area hospitals. No ability to move to a better shift, like going to day shift from night shift. Understaffed. Bad upper management just try to manipulate and micro-manage rather than do anything good for its employees.

review_title: Good training but office was not very professional
job_title: Medical Records Technician in Madison, IN
pros: Good training, nice people, casual atmosphere
cons: For some reason, the office rules were different for me. I was striving for advancement but was intercepted by negativity.

review_title: All that matters is the bottom line.
pros: Employees carrying the KDH insurance plan could get MOST generic meds filled at the KDH pharmacy for a 0 (zero) co-pay.
cons: Despite trying to portray itself to the local community as a caring, hometown facility, all that really mattered to KDH was achieving a "big city" status in a hometown setting by building a new facility that included NO additional beds over the old facility and NO expansion of services (although the community was promised that cardiac services would be expanded to include interventional cardiac catheterization services), and then they decided to pay for the new facility by outsourcing our jobs with a mere 40-day notice.  KDH is over-priced in its services, often charging 2-3 times more than other area facilities.  It is a rip-off.

pros: The co-workers work well together as a team.  Beautiful facility.  Has to potential to be a top notch organization.
cons: No potential for advancement in career. Often times they manipulate the rules to their benefit. No raise in past 3 years.  Often times under staffed. Physicians having derogatory attitude towards nurses, although they seem to be getting better.

pros: Worked for some nice doctors, some jerk doctors, but my coworkers and patients were what kept me going every day.
cons: Base pay was low, only got $2.60 worth of raises over 4yrs, come on!!

pros: close to home.   enjoy working with the people i know.
cons: No room for advancement, no tuition reimbursement, no yearly raises.

review_title: Overall, a good place to work.
pros: Good pay and benefits, great co-workers, nice environment, new technolgy
cons: Short staffed often, certain shifts didn't have enough coverage for uninterrupted lunch breaks

pros: This is a very nice place to work and i just love it
cons: Sometimes we use to be short

pros: Great place to work, Great environment
